results.title: Splash
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Buena Vista and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy fairytale about a most unlikely liaison between a beautiful mermaid (Daryl Hannah) and a New York businessman, Allen Bauer (Tom Hanks). The two first meet when Allen (as a young boy) is rescued from drowning by the lovely mermaid, but it is many years later before the two are reunited on land in New York and our mermaid has transformed into Madison with legs in place of her fishy tail. Madison not only tries to hide her identity from Allen but she also has to keep her legs away from water - or her telltale fin will return. Added to this, Madison has also captured the interest of an obsessed scientist (Eugene Levy). Light-hearted entertainment with great support from John Candy as Allen’s brother Freddie Bauer.

results.title: Powder
results.creator_credit: Victor Salva, Daniel Grodnik, Roger Birnbaum, Caravan Pictures and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: A sci-fi film about a 16-year-old albino boy who, having spent all his life living in his grandparents basement until their passing away, suddenly finds himself in a totally foreign environment when he is removed from his home and placed into school. Jeremy Reed (Sean Patrick Flanery) nick-named Powder, has special powers but his strange physical appearance and behaviour causes division within the school and the community with bigotry and hatred on one side and respect and friendship on the other. An unusual modern day fable. Cast includes Mary Steenburgen, Lance Henriksen, Jeff Goldblum.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victor Salva, Daniel Grodnik, Roger Birnbaum, Caravan Pictures and Hollywood Pictures

results.title: Holy man
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, Roger Birnbaum and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: An examination and re-evaluation of morals and ethics drives this comedy/drama about a television executive and a marketing manager who despite loathing each other, must work together. The two identify their misguided paths assisted by an enigmatic character named ‘G’, who seems to possess miraculous powers. Stars Eddie Murphy (as G), Jeff Goldblum and Kelly Preston.

results.title: The Doctor
results.creator_credit: Randa Haines, Laura Ziskin and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: William Hurt stars as a doctor who faces his mortality and his own, previously callous, handling of patients, when he himself becomes seriously ill. As well as being a personal drama about one man’s journey into self discovery and self awareness, the narrative also, in part, addressees the inequities of the American medical system whereby the medical care of the poor is seriously compromised. Also stars Alan Arkin and Elizabeth Perkins.

results.title: Asylum
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Max J Rosenberg, Milton Subotsky, Amicus Productions and Harbour productions
results.brief_description: Are the patients incurably insane or just part of the occult? A young psychiatric doctor (Robert Powell) visits an asylum where he is to have a short residency. Upon arriving he finds out the director/leading doctor has now become a patient and is upstairs with the other sick people. There are four patients and the young doctor is to guess which of the patients is the now mad Dr B. Starr and in doing so, will get to keep the job. One by one we learn the patient’s bizarre stories. The first story is of a young woman (Barbara Parkins) involved with a married man - he chops up his wife and puts her in a freezer. The young woman visits but finds the man in the freezer instead and she is attacked. The next story stars Peter Cushing as a customer of a tailor, he wants the tailor to make a suit for his dead son to be re-incarnated but the plans go array. The next patient is a delusional young girl (Charlotte Rampling) who has a split personality ‘Lucy’ (Britt Ekland) upon who she blames the murder of her brother and nurse. The final patient used to be a doctor and makes creepy robot models that have fully functioning brains and murderous intentions. Scary fun stuff with appropriate orchestral music to make sure you know when something weird is about to happen and the final twist reveals just who is Dr Starr.

results.title: Atanarjuat the fast runner
results.creator_credit: Zacharias Kunuk, Canadian Television Fund, Canadian Television Fund License Fee Program and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Hailed as the first feature ever in the Inuktitut language, this film won numerous accolades for its stunning cinematography and exceptional setting - ancient frozen lands of the Artic circle. Based on an olden Inuit legend, this fable is set at the dawn of the millennium, and is the story of a man, Atanarjuat, whose love for a woman (betrothed to another) sees him challenge his rival, enlisting the help of his powerful older brother. Romantic rivalry, jealousy, murder, rape and betrayal, all ensue as a menacing force - brought to their village by a shaman - beset the tribe. The period detail of the era is painstakingly recreated here, making the film, from an anthropological perspective, a fascinating view of a way of life untainted by Western influence. Shot of widescreen digital video on location in Igloolik, Nunavut, Canada.

results.title: In celebration
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Ely Landau and Almo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Atmospheric adaptation of David Storey’s emotionally charged play, about three sons who return to their Yorkshire mining town for their parent’s wedding anniversary - an event that stirs up suppressed resentment, childhood memories and bitterness, despite the men’s successful lives. Impressive performances from Alan Bates, James Bolam and Brian Cox who reprise their stage roles as the three middle class sons. Part of the American Film Theatre Collection.

results.title: The Man in the glass booth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, Ely Landau, Cinevision Ltee and Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Searing adaptation made for the American Film Theatre collection, of the Robert Shaw play, about a wealthy Jewish man living in Manhattan who is beset by demons and paranoia. A survivor of the Holocaust, Arthur Goldman is one day kidnapped and shipped to Israel where he is tried for war crimes. But is this character the victim or the perpetrator? With its claustrophobic and minimalist setting, Arthur Hiller teases out the themes of guilt, paranoia, conspiracy theories and martyrdom. Maximillian Schell was nominated for an Academy Award for his portrayal of Goldman, but the adaptation itself was controversial, with Shaw removing his name from the credits, due to dissatisfaction with Edward Anhalt’s screenplay.

results.title: Walkabout (1970) [DVD]
results.brief_description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister (Jenny Agutter) and her young brother (Lucien John) left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They are rescued by a young First Nations man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood. During their journey Gulpilil courts the young woman, though in her incomprehension she rejects his advances. The vision of paradise lost presented with an often surreal intensity is that of a European outsider, who sees white history as invasive and deeply destructive. Also stars John Meillon, Robert McDara, Pete Carver, John Illingsworth, Hilary Bamberger, Barry Donnelly, Noelene Brown and Carlo Machini. Cinematography by Nicolas Roeg. Screenplay by Edward Bond, based on the novel by James Vance Marshall. Edited by Antony Gibbs and Alan Pattillo. Music composed and conducted by John Barry. Also available on VHS [309075].

results.title: Feel like going home
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”, “Feel like going home” is Scorsese’s own directorial contribution, tracing the blues from the Mississippi Delta back to its roots in the Niger River, Mali. Musician Corey Harris acts as a guide along the journey, conducting interviews with a variety of musicians and engaging in song with several. Whilst examining the musical milieu of the Mississippi Delta, Scorsese addresses the work of Alan Lomax, the pioneering musicologist who recorded innumerable obscure American musicians and singers. Presents brilliant vintage footage of early blues men, such as Son House and John Lee Hooker whilst painting a picture of the rural poverty that dominated the lives of these future greats. Original performances include Willie King, Corey Harris, Taj Mahal, Keb Mo, Otha Turner, Habib Koite, Salif Keita, and Ali Farke Toure.
